column1: I must speak out for the gay community. I am standing here today to fight for equality. I am a gay man, who is now married to a lesbian. I do not get to be a gay man. I have to be a gay man, but not a lesbian. I am a gay man.
[I am standing here today to fight for equality. I am a gay man, who is now married to a lesbian. I do not get to be a gay man. I have to be a gay man. I am a gay man.]
But there are a couple of comments that are far more interesting.
The first is this sentence:
I am a lesbian. It's the most important thing I can say.
The second is this quote in the same sentence:
I am a gay man. It's the most important thing I can say.
The third is this quote:
I am a lesbian. It's the most important thing I can say.
